title: Coconut Rhubarb Amaranth Porridge
summary: Coconut Rhubarb Amaranth Porridge might be just the morn meal you are searching for. This recipe makes 2 servings with 609 calories, 12g of protein, and 34g of fat each. For $3.93 per serving, this recipe covers 26% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It will be a hit at your Mother's Day event. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and vegan diet. 11 person have made this recipe and would make it again. A mixture of amaranth, extra coconut milk and coconut to serve, medjool dates, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so scrumptious. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 80%, this dish is solid. Similar recipes include Amaranth Porridge, Pumpkin Pie Amaranth Porridge, and Blueberries ‘n’ Cream Amaranth Porridge.
instructions: Soak Amaranth over night (if possible.)Drain and rinse amaranth. Combine with one cup coconut and salt. Bring amaranth to a boil, and reduce to a simmer (all the way to low.) Cover and let simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let sit for 10 more minutes to thicken amaranth.In a separate pot, combine the 3 cups rhubarb, 1/4 cup coconut milk, 1 tablespoon cinnamon, and 1/2 cup dates that have been pitted and roughly chopped. Heat over medium low until rhubarb is cooked and has broken down. Taste and add extra cinnamon if needed.Stir rhubarb in to amaranth and serve. Sprinkle with toasted* coconut and extra coconut milk.

steps.step: Combine with one cup coconut and salt. Bring amaranth to a boil, and reduce to a simmer (all the way to low.) Cover and let simmer for 15 minutes.

Remove from heat and let sit for 10 more minutes to thicken amaranth.In a separate pot, combine the 3 cups rhubarb, 1/4 cup coconut milk, 1 tablespoon cinnamon, and 1/2 cup dates that have been pitted and roughly chopped.
Heat over medium low until rhubarb is cooked and has broken down. Taste and add extra cinnamon if needed.Stir rhubarb in to amaranth and serve.
Sprinkle with toasted* coconut and extra coconut milk.
